newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Oct 17.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Oct 17.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on Oct 17:
WASHINGTON - About 60 million Americans will get a 2.9 percent increase in their government cheques next year as a result of cost-of-living adjustments in social security programs.
WASHINGTON - The Asian community represents a growth area in Democratic Party fund raising and one that has generated controversy.
LONDON - The British government proposed one of the strictest gun control laws in the world outlawing private possession of handguns.

WASHINGTON - A panel appointed by Virginia Governor George Allen has proposed lowering the education requirements for day care center employees prompting criticism from several children's advocacy group.
WASHINGTON - David Brinkley, a giant of television news over the past three decades, announced he is stepping down as moderator of ABC's "This Week With David Brinkley" after the November 10 edition.
